item.title: Report X-2023120954
item.description:
Report X-2023120954

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-30T17:46:52+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-18
  • City: HAMMOND
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1. X-2023120954 SequenceEvent: Upon walking to a load door, a hazmat package was discovered damaged. Hazmat drum was receive from the cage and hazmat was place inside the drum. All materials was placed in drum and area cleaned. There was no one present, therefor the area did not need to be blocked off. DescribePack: Package was wet and contents within the package was damaged. The bottles of the container was cracked. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Package was picked up from the area and placed in hazmat drum. neutralizer was placed on the area of the spill. 2. X-2023120964 SequenceEvent: PACKAGE WAS DISCOVERED BY LOAD DOOR WITH INTERNAL LEAKAGE. HAZMAT DRUM WAS RETRIEVED AND PACKAGE WAS PLACED IN DRUM. AREA WAS NOT BLOCKED BECAUSE THERE WERE NO PEOPLE PRESENT. AREA WAS CLEANED WITH HAZMAT SUPPLIED AND CLEARED. DescribePack: BOTTOM OF THE PACKAGE WAS COMPLETELY SOAKED. UPON OPENING PACKAGE, CAPS WAS LEAKING AND THE BODY WAS CRACKED. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: PACKAGE WAS PLACED QUICKLY IN A HAZMAT DRUM AND AREA CLEANED.

item.title: Report I-2023090117
item.description:
Report I-2023090117

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-31T00:35:56+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-04
  • City: JEFFERSONVILLE
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Univar Solutions USA Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Driver arrived at customer to fill a sulfuric tank. He verified the tank, quantity, product, and connections before starting to pump. The driver started the pump and after a couple of minutes he noticed sulfuric acid leaking out of the pump box. The driver immediately shut it down and notified his supervisor. The customer blocked off the nearest sewer drain with boom and absorbent. A third party cleanup contractor was sent in to neutralize and remove the product that was released. The cause of the release was determined to be two loose nuts on the flange that connects the outbound side of the pump to the hose reel. Going forward we will be checking the torque on all nuts inside this pump box monthly.
